title: The Negative (Den). "I do not have".
reading_greek: Έχω ένα σκύλο. Δεν έχω γάτα. Έχεις έναν φίλο. Δεν έχεις αδελφό. Έχουμε σπίτι.
reading_english: I have a dog. I do not have a cat. You have a friend. You do not have a brother. We have a house.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 3 of your Greek journey. ... Today, we are mastering The Negative in Greek, using the simple, but crucial word: ΔΕΝ ... or, 'Den'. ... Den means 'not' or 'do not'. ... It is placed directly before the verb. ... For example, to say 'I do not have', you simply say 'Den Ého'. ... ... Let's look at today's reading passage and focus on the negative constructions. ... Listen carefully: ... Έχω ένα σκύλο. ... Δεν έχω γάτα. ... Έχεις έναν φίλο. ... Δεν έχεις αδελφό. ... Έχουμε σπίτι. ... ... Now, let's break down the new vocabulary. ... Σκύλος means 'dog'. ... Γάτα means 'cat'. ... Αδελφός means 'brother'. ... ... Remember, place Den immediately before the verb to make it negative. ... Den Ého... I do not have. ... Den Éhis... You do not have. ... ... Practice saying the negative forms aloud. ... Listen again and try to repeat the Greek sentences, paying attention to the position of Den. ... Έχω ένα σκύλο. ... Δεν έχω γάτα. ... Έχεις έναν φίλο. ... Δεν έχεις αδελφό. ... Έχουμε σπίτι.
